intro: Centunculus pumilus var. pentandrus, commonly known as the five-stamen mouse-ear. This plant is a flowering species belonging to the family Primulaceae, characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The variety pentandrus is distinguished by its five stamens, which is a key botanical feature. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments and is often used in horticultural settings for its ornamental value.
